title: Tara Brown s mum rejects murderer Lionel Patea s apology - Yahoo7
text:
Share Tara Brown s mum rejects murderer Lionel Patea s apology - Yahoo7 A grieving mother says she'll never read the letter written by the former bikie who forced her daughter off the road and fatally bashed her as she lay trapped in her wrecked car. Family speaks after Patea sentencing 
Natalie Hinton says former Bandidos bikie Lionel Patea is "a monster". 
She's vowed never to read a "worthless" letter he penned to her, after finally admitting in court on Monday that he'd murdered Ms Hinton's 24-year-old daughter Tara Brown in the most horrific of circumstances. 
"His apology to Tara. It's worth nothing now that she's gone," Ms Hinton told the media. Natalie Hinton said she will never read Lionel Patea's apology letter. Source: 7 News Lionel Patea said he hopes Tara's beautiful soul will live on through their daughter. Source: New Zealand Herald 
Patea pleaded guilty on Monday to the bludgeoning murder of his former partner 18 months ago, after he ran her off the road following a terrifying high-speed chase on the Gold Coast. His admission came on the same day his Brisbane trial had been due to start. 
In a bizarre letter intended for Ms Brown's family, Patea said he was remorseful and would bring her back if he could. But he also pondered about how "such a tragedy" could occur. 
"The question that haunts us all (is) how such a tragedy like this could ever have happened," he wrote in the letter, tendered in court by his defence team. 
He said he didn't have the answers and "can't clarify it for myself either". Tara Brown's daughter will now grow up without her mother after Lionel Patea brutally murdered her. Source: Facebook Close Lionel Patea sentenced to life behind bars UP NEXT VIDEO Lionel Patea sentenced to life behind bars Lionel Patea sentenced to life behind bars 
But Ms Hinton said nothing Patea could say could excuse the explosion of violence that robbed the former couple's very young daughter of her mother, and left the child with a father serving 20 years in jail for the killing. 
"There is not a day go by that she doesn't ask for Tara. We started with 'I miss Mummy. I want Mummy'. Then we moved to 'I want to see Mummy'. And then just the other week, she asked me if she was was going to get a new mummy. Just like her mummy," Ms Hinton said. 
Ms Brown had taken out a domestic violence order against Patea just days before he rammed her off a suburban Gold Coast road in September 2015. 'Lionel no... please help me': Murdered mum's desperate final plea 
The 25-year-old miner then used a metal fire hydrant cover weighing 7.8kg to repeatedly bash her as she lay trapped inside the overturned vehicle. 
Ms Hinton said her daughter had told police she was afraid for her life when she went to them for help in the days before she died. 
But she says police responded by asking why she hadn't sought help earlier, as her fears ramped up. Lionel Patea pleaded guilty to all charges over the murder of his former partner, Tara Brown. Source: 7 News 
"Lionel Patea had a record as long as our arms. He was known, his violent behaviour. He was known as a Bandidos bikie and Tara was scared. She was hoping the police would put in place the domestic violence order," Ms Hinton said. 
But she urged women in violent domestic situations not to be deterred from seeking help. 
"Just gather your strength. Find your support. Whether it be a family member, a friend, a doctor, a teacher. There is help out there. And that help can keep you safe," Ms Hinton said. 
National domestic violence helpline: 1800 737 732 or 1800RESPECT. In an emergency call triple-zero.
